required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of a Warming Mattress on Perioperative Hypothermia Following Cesarean Delivery
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Warming Mattress on Perioperative Hypothermia Following Cesarean Delivery

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary aim of the current study will be to determine if the use of an underbody heating mattress during cesarean sections will decrease the incidence of postoperative hypothermia, defined as core temperature less than 36C, and if hypothermia occurs, time to normothermia. As part of the primary outcome the difference in the incidence of shivering, its severity, and need for treatment will be investigated. As a secondary goal other maternal perioperative outcomes will be studied i.e. estimated blood loss, change in hemoglobin level on the morning after surgery ie postop day 1, need for blood transfusion, rate of wound infections, length of hospital stay, maternal satisfaction, time to first breastfeeding, time to first 'skin to skin' contact. The relationship between maternal hypothermia and newborn outcomes of temperature and APGAR scores will also be evaluated.
Active preoperative and intraoperative warming may prevents inadvertent perioperative hypothermia and may be beneficial for pregnant patients undergoing cesarean delivery. The underbody warming mattress may be a step towards finding a suitable form of warming that is comfortable for awake patients, does not interfere with skin to skin contact and maternal-fetal bonding.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minute intervals until normothermic, up to 45 minutes after admission Post Anesthesia Care Unit
primary_outcome.description: Temperature at time of post anesthesia care unit admission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 15 minute intervals until no shivering, up to 45 minutes after admission Post Anesthesia Care Unit
secondary_outcome.description: Shivering at time of post anesthesia care unit admission

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preop up to 45 minutes after admission Post Anesthesia Care Unit, 15 min intervals
secondary_outcome.description: Vitals: Heart Rate from preoperative through end of post anesthesia recovery unit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Documented at the end of 2 hour surgical procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Estimated blood loss with and without warming

secondary_outcome.time_frame: time from delivery to first maternal contact during the 2 hour surgical procedure
secondary_outcome.description: time to neonatal bonding as skin to skin

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preop up to 45 minutes after admission Post Anesthesia Care Unit, 15 min intervals
secondary_outcome.description: Thermal comfort visual analog scale with scores 0-100 with 50 being temperature comfort/neutral, 100 being hottest, 0 being cold

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preop up to 45 minutes after admission Post Anesthesia Care Unit, 15 min intervals
secondary_outcome.description: Vitals: Oxygen Saturation from preoperative through end post anesthesia recovery unit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preop up to 45 minutes after admission Post Anesthesia Care Unit, 15 min intervals
secondary_outcome.description: Vitals: blood pressure as mean arterial pressure

arm_group.description: Underbody warmer will be underneath the patient and turned on.
Underbody warmer will be underneath the patient but not turned on.

intervention.description: Use of VitaHeat underbody heating mattress will be used for the intervention arm to reduce hypothermia post operatively

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- will be age >18 years,
- singleton pregnancy >37 weeks,
- neuraxial anesthesia,
- healthy afebrile patients.
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ will be age >18 years,
- singleton pregnancy >37 weeks,
- neuraxial anesthesia,
- healthy afebrile patients.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
